info.name: Autoblog.nl Dark
info.description: Modern, light-weight dark theme for autoblog.nl with a decluttered design and easy on the eyes. Features: • Total dark make-over while respecting the original brand-styling. • A decluttered and more consistent layout; easy on the eyes. • Optimized primary-content width and font-styling for improved readability. • Round-borders, subtle shadows, transparency and a themed scrollbar   make it more slick & modern looking. • Removes the large, redundant 'floormat' footer. • Effective Ad-suppression even without a dedicated Ad-Blocker plugin.   It does not block tracking, but does suppress the display of all Ads including   Branded Content articles. Note: Moved to userstyles.world and Stylus as primary styler; this might not be the most recent version.
info.additionalInfo: v2.59 | 2023-06-13 • Styled the updated photo gallery. v2.58 | 2022-10-19 • Supressed white block at the footer of article pages. v2.57 | 2022-10-14 • Updated Ad-suppression on articles. v2.56 | 2022-10-09 • Suppressed new Ad in main-page header. v2.55 | 2022-09-14 • Suppressed new white background for 'Must login' box below articles when not logged on. • Suppressed gray border below top-banner. • Removed margin-fix for 'Mijn Autoblog' top menu item on the right, as it's now fixed by AB. • Removed top-menu background-gradient; menu text looks a bit 'bolder' as a result. • Removed transition-markup from scrollbar CSS. v2.54 | 2022-07-02 • Added some red glow (text-shadow) to article links to make them stand out more. v2.53 | 2022-06-15 • Fixed submenu font-size being too large v2.52 | 2022-01-27 • Updated 'spot' text-color for license-plate styling from white to black • Removed the hardcoded inline-style black borders from the 'spot' page photo gallery • Removed white border-line below site-header / above top menu-bar v2.51 | 2022-01-09 • Updated submenu, dropdown menu's and header styles to be fully compatible with new layout v2.50 | 2021-12-07 • Support new website theming (menu, pagination). • Added this theme to UserStyles.world; which is now the new primary home of this theme (!) v2.42 | 2021-10-30 • Minor fix to the pagination-button hover-color. v2.41 | 2021-05-26 • Minor update to the YouTube iframes to give it a larger min-height. v2.40 | 2021-05-14 I didn't visit the website for a while, and it shows; lots of changes to the HTML markup: • Fixed the updated link colors of the widgets to not have every clickable text always be red • Finally fully suppressed the 'Branded Content' articles on the homepage • Updated (non 'Branded Content' related) Ad-suppression • Updated pagination padding to be touch-friendly again • Many minor updates to padding, margin and fonts, as the site finally seems to move away from legacy markup. This does mean lots of rework & cleanup for me to, so except a few minor, yet frequent updates like after the previous 'redesign' v2.30 | 2021-01-08 • Fixed margin of the newly introduced 'Ook interessant' widget v2.29 | 2020-10-26 • Updated the table-listing layout again (i.e. F1 race results) v2.28 | 2020-08-01 • Re-tweaked the menubar-padding after a site-update v2.27 | 2020-07-20 • Added support for the new table-listing layout (i.e. F1 race results) v2.26 | 2020-05-17 • Website updated its font, adjusted pagination-styling to make it fit again v2.25 | 2020-04-11 • Added rounded borders to the updated sidebar video and image styles v2.24 | 2020-04-09 • Darkened the newly introduced white background behind the rounded borders of the embedded YT player. v2.23 | 2020-03-27 The website markup got a few changes again: • Restyled the updated 'Lease Widget' • Changed some of the sidebar padding and line-heights • Increased the sidebars 'Hete Discussie' font-size by 1px. • Restyled the updated Formule 1, Lease, Rijtesten thematic H1 titles v2.22 | 2020-03-22 • Updated embedded video-player markup to make it a 100% wide again after site-markup change • Updated blockquote design • Updated markup for old v1 design article image-width to make them more consistent • Updated the button styling when editing a comment • Slightly decreased the line-spacing between links-listings in the sidebar v2.21 | 2020-03-18 • Newsletter signup markup changed again, adapted theme v2.20 | 2020-03-14 • Darkened the webshop at shop.autoblog.nl too • Darkened new search helper-element artifact • Suppressed the Cookie-approval overlay • Re-added dark-styles for the 'v1 design' photo-carrousel for old articles • Minor CSS cleanup v2.15 | 2020-03-09 • Darkened the reply and like buttons and made their height also consistent with eachother • Darkened the new newsletter-signup widget • Updated sidebar widgets with decreased font-sizes and more consistent padding • Updated ad-suppression for the new type of ad-widget • Very minor menu-bar tweaks v2.14 | 2020-02-26 • Minor adjustments to the top-menu padding as the 'original' design starts to look more like our theme. v2.13 | 2020-02-02 • Bugfix for the submenu-transparency inconsistency introduced in v2.12. v2.12 | 2020-02-01 • Made the sticky main nav-bar and it's sub-menu's slightly transparent and shrunk it's height by 5px. • Darkened updated blockquote's. • Darkened updated table-style. • Styled some legacy pages that uses new layout markup, i.e. 'Vraagbaak'. v2.10 | 2020-01-31 This update makes the v2 theme very close to the v1 theme from before the site-overhaul again: • The homepage article-listing is a bit wider at the expense of the sidebar. • All the title font-sizes are now the same size and mostly smaller than before.   This results in significantly less line-wrap and a cleaner ook. • Added a few extra tweaks to the progressive image-sizing for lower/mobile resolutions. v2.01 | 2020-01-30 • Updated active page-number and article-metadata :hover styling. • Slightly increased the margin between paragraphs. v2.00 | 2020-01-29 • The website's design got a major/full overhaul; hence the v2 version number. • Dropped almost all legacy CSS markup from the v1.xx branches; a clean start. • Updated the Ad-suppression as the new layout changed that too. • Both the site and the v2 theme are a work-in-progress, expect updates.
